crypto.name: Attack of the Clones
crypto.desc: I don't like sand. It's coarse and rough and irritating, and it gets everywhere. Not like here. Here, everything is soft and smooth.

crypto.name: Ez Part
crypto.desc: I finally finished my new login system. It even uses 2 different verification systems!

crypto.name: Guess Flag
crypto.desc: You will never guess the flag

crypto.name: Quantum vernam
crypto.desc: I used perfect secrecy to encode these qubits

crypto.name: Revenge of the Sith
crypto.desc: Master Skywalker, there are too many of them. What are we going to do?

crypto.name: The Phantom Menace
crypto.desc: A long time ago, in a galaxy far far away...

misc.name: Pls respond
misc.desc: What are these SMS I received as soon as I connected to the gNB? Hint: To confiure NAS5GS, please follow this guide https://github.com/SysSec-KAIST/LTESniffer/blob/main/pcap_file_example/README.md for the first part and enable the NR/5GS equivalent protocols of the LTEs one presented in 2nd part (i.e. MAC-NR,PDCP-NR,RLC-NR,NAS-5GS) PS:These packets are valid transmissions with an actual phone

misc.name: Wordler
misc.desc: yo dawg i heard you like words in your wordle so i put words in your words so words

misc.name: illegal downloading
misc.desc: I downloaded a track from Soundcloud on a sketchy website. Somehow the cover images seem both a bit off? But I cannot find any notable difference, maybe they got modified to hide something? The two images contain two different flags but they're both valid to solve this challenge, you just need a single one. Wrap the flag inside EPFL{}!

misc.name: zipbomb
misc.desc: Have you thought about maybe downloading more RAM? I've heard it helps you get to the bottom of things.

pwn.name: New Mitigations
pwn.desc: If you send a Pwndbg PR to fix this I will give you the first 5 letters of the flag.

pwn.name: Unlink THIS
pwn.desc: In computer science, a doubly linked list is a linked data structure that consists of a set of sequentially linked records called nodes.

pwn.name: stackception 2
pwn.desc: Something something stack on the stack

pwn.name: still not malloc
pwn.desc: so this year I wrote another terrible allocator whose sole purpose is to be pwned

rev.name: A real CTF
rev.desc: I will show you what a real CTF is...

rev.name: dilemma
rev.desc: A classic dilemma. Hint: there are no hidden tricks. You're sandboxed, don't waste tiem poking the filesystem or the network. You just need to solve it the standard way. Example python: while True: print(1)\nEOF

web.name: MagicAuth
web.desc: No passwords or validation codes needed! Authenticate via email with our revolutionary MagicAuth™ system.
